title: November 2023
text:
Where
BHF Centre of Research Excellence, 126 University Place, Room C222/C223
When you get to the venue, there is security at the entrance and they will point you out in the right direction. This building is like a maze.

title: December 2023
text:
To celebrate the end of the year, we’ll be having a Christmas Quiz! Hope to see you there!

Where: seminar rooms 422/423 in the School of Computing Science (Sir Alwyn Williams Building) at 18 Lilybank Gardens.
When: 4:00 pm on Wednesday 13th December

title: Glasgow Computational Biology Community
text:
If you’re using a computer to solve a biology problem and you’re at the University of Glasgow, you are part of the Glasgow Computational Biology community. Come along to one of our events!


Regular events to share science and have a chat!
The community hosts events to chat about cool innovations in computational biology and bioinformatics. We have events across the university at the main campus at Gilmorehill and at various centres at Garscube and then often head to the pub. Come join us!



The next Glasgow Computational Biology conference will happen in 2024. Thanks to all who came to 2023’s great event.

title: Next Event
text:
Metabolomics

3:30pm on Friday October 27th in SAWB 422/423 (School of Computing Science)
We have 3 exciting talks lined up with speakers information below. The talks will be in Room 422/423 of the Sir Alwyn Williams Building (SAWB) in the School of Computing Science. And come along to the pub afterwards!

Mike Barrett: Metabolomics in Drug Discovery
Gavin Blackburn: Metabolomics Data Analysis- why it’s not so straightforward
Clement Regnault: Metabolomics: applications in biology

title: February 2024
text:
Dr John Fozard (Center for Virus Research, UofG) : Coarsening dynamics can explain meiotic crossover patterning.
Dr Xiao Fu (Cancer Research UK Scotland Institute):  Integrating computational modelling with experimental systems to study human cancers.
Dr Raimondo Penta (School of Maths & Stats, UofG): Multi scale homogenisation and its application to vascular tumours - an overview.

Where: room 248, Bower Building (Botany Gate, Glasgow, G12 8QQ)
When: Tuesday 20th February 2024, 3pm


Looking forward to seeing you all, 
CompBio organisers

title: January 2024
text:
We have a talk lined up by the first author of Assembly theory explains and quantifies selection and evolution. Abhishek’s talk will first give us an overview of the work happening in Cronin’s lab before focusing on assembly theory. 

When: Jan. 25th, 4pm 
Where: Maths and Stats: 116 Lecture Theatre


Looking forward to seeing you all,
CompBio organisers
